BaseValue - Class in de.rumford.tradingsystem
The BaseValue is a substantial part for every trading system and provides the values to be decided upon by the rules.
BaseValue(String, ValueDateTupel[]) - Constructor for class de.rumford.tradingsystem.BaseValue
Creates a new BaseValue instance using the passed String for identification and stores the passed array of ValueDateTupel as values.
BaseValue(String, ValueDateTupel[], ValueDateTupel[]) - Constructor for class de.rumford.tradingsystem.BaseValue
Creates a new BaseValue instance using the passed String for identification and stores the passed array of ValueDateTupel as values and the second passed array of ValueDateTupel as shortIndexValues.

CsvFormat - Enum in de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper
This enum provides the most common ways a CSV can be structured, including the symbols for field, date, time, and thousands separator, as well as the decimal point and the order of values (year, month, day) inside the date value.

DiversificationMultiplier - Class in de.rumford.tradingsystem
The DiversificationMultiplier negates the fact that using multiple rules upon a single base value flattens the forecast curve.

EWMAC - Class in de.rumford.tradingsystem
The EWMAC is a non-binary Rule utilizing the different horizons of its 2 underlying EWMA.

I

isSortedAscending(ValueDateTupel[]) - Static method in class de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper.ValueDateTupel
Evaluate if the given array of ValueDateTupel is sorted in ascending order, i.e., if the value at position 0 has the lowest LocalDateTime value (implicit check) and all subsequent ValueDateTupel each have a LocalDateTime after (LocalDateTime.isAfter(ChronoLocalDateTime)) the previous one.
isSortedDescending(ValueDateTupel[]) - Static method in class de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper.ValueDateTupel
Evaluate if the given array of ValueDateTupel is sorted in descending order, i.e., if the value at position 0 has the highest LocalDateTime value (implicit check) and all subsequent ValueDateTupel each have a LocalDateTime before (LocalDateTime.isBefore(ChronoLocalDateTime)) the previous one.

VolatilityDifference - Class in de.rumford.tradingsystem
The VolatilityDifference is a Rule providing forecasts based on historic and recent volatility of the base value.
